commit.message:
ContextObj to improve data passing in click commands

Adds a ContextObj class to more easily pass data between different click
commands. Before this, the data passing was done via a list, which was
error-prone (because unstructured) and hard to understand.

utils.IS_PY2 helper constant

Makes checking for Python 2.x more clean and consistent.

commit-msg hook in python

This moves the business logic of the commit-msg hook from the hook
script to python. This makes the commit-msg hook much more portable
across shells and OSes, as well as easier to unit test.

This should fix #127

Improved debug logging

Gitlint will now log (when using --debug):
 - The encoding it uses
 - All git commands it executes

Also fixed a bug with missing debug output when invoking gitlint as a python
module: python -m gitlint.cli

Ignore .python-version

Ignored .python-version files generated by pyenv.

PR request template

Template that emphasizes expectations for contributors wrt turn-around
time.

Check runs are now also trigged by PRs

This should catch issues before they are merged.
Relates to #134

Added 'ci' and 'build' to conventional commit types (#135)

This completes the list of possible commit message types listed under bullet point 4 in conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#summary.

commit.message:
Version bump to 0.14.0dev

Bumped version to 0.14.0dev.

0.13.1 release

- Patch to enable --staged flag for pre-commit.
- Minor doc updates #109

Full Release details in CHANGELOG.md.

./run_tests.sh tweaks

Most importantly, a fix to properly deactivate virtualenv.

Docs: pre-commit invocation details

Minor doc edit outlining how to invoke gitlint with additional arguments
through gitlint.

This fixes #109

Use tools\windows\run_tests.bat in Github Actions

Previously we directly invoked pytest, using run_tests.bat is cleaner.

Enabled --staged flag for pre-commit

Not much more to it :-)

Version bump to 0.14.0dev

Bumped version to 0.14.0dev.

0.13.0 release

- Behavior Change: Revert Commits are now recognized and ignored by default #99
- --staged flag: gitlint can now detect meta-data (such as author details,
  changed files, etc) of staged/pre-commits. Useful when you use gitlint's
  commit-msg hook or precommit (#105)
- New branch properties on GitCommit and GitContext, useful when writing your
  own user-defined rules: commit.branches and commit.context.current_branch #108
- Python 3.8 support
- Python 3.4 no longer supported. Python 3.4 has reached EOL and an increasing
  of gitlint's dependencies have dropped support which makes it hard to maintain
- Improved Windows support: better unicode handling.
- Bugfixes:
  - Gitlint no longer crashes when acting on empty repositories (this only
    occurred in specific circumstances).
  - Changed files are now better detected in repos that only have a root commit
- Improved performance and memory (gitlint now caches git properties)
- Improved --debug output
- Improved documentation
- Under-the-hood: dependencies updated, unit and integration test improvements,
  migrated from TravisCI to Github Actions.

Full Release details in CHANGELOG.md.

Changelog updates

Getting the Changelog ready for the 0.13.0 release.

Temporarily disabling coveralls.io reporting

Coveralls doesn't play nicely with GH Actions and Python.

Detect changed files in single-commit repository

Gitlint didn't properly detect changed files in repositories that only contained
a single commit. This patch fixes that :-)

Remove TravisCI for CI

Using Github Actions instead now.

CI using Github Actions

Trying out CI using Github Actions - plan is to eventually move away
from TravisCI.

Currently still using TravisCI to deal with unit test coverage reporting
(there are some issues with GH actions and coveralls.io).

On windows, we deliberately allow some tests to fail - these are known
issues on windows.

Commit-msg hook now uses --staged flag

This will tell gitlint to fetch additional meta-info when linting the
passed commit message.

Empty repo detection

Gitlint now detects when a git repository has no commits and displays an
appropriate error message.

Docker images for end-users

Images published on:
https://hub.docker.com/r/jorisroovers/gitlint

Documentation updates

- Reviewed and cleaned up all documentation
- Updated CHANGELOG for upcoming 0.13.0 release
- Added some more stats to ./run_tests.sh :-)

Test fixes and cleanup

- Implemented some missing equality tests
  (and updated some __eq__ methods along the way)
- Split up some large test files
- Changed some of the DEBUG output wording
- Misc minor test refactoring and tweaking

Only allow --staged when using stdin or --msg-filename

The --staged fla has no meaning when using it without sending input to stdin or
passing a message via --msg-filename. This commit adds some more
user-friendly error handling around this.

Also moved some exception handling in the cli.py module around, so all
exceptions are handled at the top-level cli() function.

Enable fetching commit metadata using --staged

This commit actually enables the --staged CLI flag.

To easily test this capability, the debug output has been extended to include
branches and changed files.

Tests have been added and updated as needed.

This commit relates to #105

--staged CLI flag

The --staged flag will allow users to tell gitlint to fetch additional
commit meta-info from the current git stage.

This will allow users to lint a commit message passed via stdin or
--commit-msg while still fetching additional meta information from the
underlying repo (e.g. changed files, author name, etc).

This relates to #105

StagedLocalGitCommit object to better support staged commits

The StagedLocalGitCommit object combines a user-passed git commit
message with meta-data that is fetched from a local git repository.

This relates to #105
